IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: MADEIRA IS A GIRLS SCHOOL BY DESIGN WHERE EVERY ASPECT OF ACADEMIC, SOCIAL AND ATHLETIC LIFE IS DIRECTED TOWARD EDUCATING THE NEXT GENERATION OF YOUNG WOMEN FOR LEADERSHIP.
IRS990.MissionDesc: EDUCATION - FOUNDED IN 1906, MADEIRA IS A BOARDING AND DAY COLLEGE PREPARTORY SCHOOL FOR GIRLS IN GRADES NINE THROUGH TWELVE. MADEIRA IS A GIRLS SCHOOL BY DESIGN WHERE EVERY ASPECT OF ACADEMIC, SOCIAL AND ATHLETIC LIFE IS DIRECTED TOWARD EDUCATING THE NEXT GENERATION OF YOUNG WOMEN FOR LEADERSHIP.
IRS990.Desc: BOARDING SCHOOL FOR GIRLS PROVIDING HIGH SCHOOL EDUCATION (313 STUDENTS)

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: LOOMIS SAYLES HIGH GRADE CORPORATE BONDS
SOMERSET SMALL MID CAP EM ALL COUNTRY FUND

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL IS EXEMPT UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986. THE SCHOOL HAS FILED FOR AND RECIEVED INCOME TAX EXEMPTIONS IN THE VARIOUS JURISDICTIONS WHERE IT IS REQUIRED TO DO SO. THE SCHOOL FILES FORM 990 AND 990-T (INFORMATION AND TAX RETURNS) IN THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTION AND THEIR EQUIVALENTS IN THE STATE OF VIRGINA. WITH FEW EXCPETIONS, THE SCHOOL IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2011. MANAGEMENT OF THE SCHOOL BELIEVES IT HAS NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS LOSS ON FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENT CHANGE IN VALUE OF CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVABLE (BEGINNING VERSUS ENDING BALANCE FINANCIAL AID INCLUDED IN REVENUES FOR FINANCIAL STATEMENT PURPOSES

SCHEDULE D, PART V, QUESTION 4: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 50 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES. ITS ENDOWMENT INCLUDES BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS. AS REQUIRED BY GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, NET ASSETS ASSOCIATED WITH ENDOWMENT FUNDS, INCLUDING FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS, ARE CLASSIFIED AND REPORTED BASED ON THE EXISTENCE OR ABSENCE OF DONOR-IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS FIN 48 FOOTNOTE
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL IS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986, EXCEPT FOR TAXES ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. THE SCHOOL HAS FILED FOR AND RECEIVED INCOME TAX EXEMPTIONS IN THE VARIOUS JURISDICTIONS WHERE IT IS REQUIRED TO DO SO. THE SCHOOL FILES FORMS 990 AND 990-T (INFORMATION AND TAX RETURNS) IN THE FEDERAL JURISDICTION AND THEIR EQUIVALENTS IN THE STATE OF VIRGINIA. WITH FEW EXCPETIONS, THE SCHOOL IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2012. MANAGEMENT OF THE SCHOOL BELIEVES IT HAS NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES REQUIRES THE SCHOOL'S MAMAGEMENT TO EVALUATE THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE SCHOOL AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY (OR ASSET) IF THE SCHOOL HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT BY SUSTAINTED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. THE SCHOOL'S MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE SCHOOL AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AT JUNE 30, 2016, THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY (OR ASSET) O DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
INCLUDED IN ALL NEWSPAPER ADVERTISEMENTS AND IN LISTING OF "BUNTING AND LYON DIRECTORY OF PRIVATE SCHOOLS".

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NOT REPORTING FINANCIAL AID BY STUDENT IS COVERED BY 20 U.S.C. 1232G.
THE VALUE OF HOUSING PROVIDED TO EMPLOYEES WHO LIVE ON CAMPUS IS BASED ON LOCAL REAL ESTATE RENTAL RATES FOR SIMILAR SIZED HOUSING AND IS INCLUDED IN TOTAL COMPENSATION FOR FORM 990 PURPOSES.

THE COMPENSATION OF THE EMPLOYEES (OFFICERS) IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE SCHOOL PROVIDED THAT PERSONS WITH CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WITH RESPECT TO THE COMPENSATION AGREEMENT AT ISSUE ARE NOT INVOLVED IN THIS REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THE COMPENSATION OF THE PERSON IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED USING DATA AS TO COMPARABLE COMPENSATION FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT SIMILARLY SITUATED ORGANIZATIONS.

PARRT I, LINES 9 AND 25 THE SCHOOL REPORTS THE CONTRIBUTION OF SECURITIES (PUBLICLY TRADED) AND HORSE AS SEPERATE GIFTS BASED ON THE NUMBER OF INSTANCES RECEIVED RATHER THAN A GIFT FOR EACH SHARE OR ITEM RECEIEVED. PART 1, LINES 9 AND 25, COLUMN D: THE SCHOOL DETERMINED THE METHOD OF REVENUES AS THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF THE PUBLICLY TRADED SECURITIES ON THE DAY OF THE GIFT. WITH RESPECT TO GIFTS OF HORSES, FAIR MARKET VALUE IS DETERMINED BASED ON THE ANIMAL'S VALUE TO THE SCHOOL'S RIDING PROGRAM, WHICH MAY BE DIFFERENT FROM THEIR VALUE AS A SHOW HORSE.
THE SCHOOL USES A THIRD PARTY BROKERAGE FIRM TO SELL PUBLICLY TRADED STOCKS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 50 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES. ITS ENDOWMENT INCLUDES BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS. AS REQUIRED BY GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, NET ASSETS ASSOCIATED WITH ENDOWMENT FUNDS, INCLUDING FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS, ARE CLASSIFIED AND REPORTED BASED ON THE EXISTENCE OR ABSENCE OF DONOR-IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AT THE FIRST BOARD MEETING EACH FISCAL YEAR, BOARD MEMBERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE GIVEN A FORM TO FILL OUT AND SIGN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF THE PERSON IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE SCHOOL PROVIDED THAT PERSONS WITH CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WITH RESPECT TO THE COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT AT ISSUE ARE NOT INVOLVED IN THIS REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THE COMPENSATION OF THE PERSON IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED USING DATA AS TO COMPARABLE COMPENSATION FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS IN FUNCTIONALLY COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT SIMILIARLY SITUATED ORGANIZATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. OTHER ORGANIZATIONAL DOCUMENTS ARE NOT AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
CONTRACTED SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 2,161,383. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 266,329. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 364,367. TOTAL EXPENSES 2,792,079.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS -115,784. CHANGE IN VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENT -920,223. CHANGE IN CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVABLE BETWEEN BEGINNING AND END OF YEAR 4,491,598.
THERE HAS BEEN NO CHANGE IN THE PROCESS BY WHICH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE CONDUCTS AND APPROVES THE AUDIT.
